name: Rotting Wind
description: A formidable Large Undead creature that embodies decay, capable of becoming invisible and radiating a poisonous aura.
memorable: Its ability to inflict the debilitating Tomb Rot disease makes it a formidable opponent in combat.
goals: To spread decay and infect living creatures.
relations: May be associated with other undead or disease-based creatures.
environment: Often found in decaying environments or graveyards.
strengths: High mobility and the ability to turn invisible, along with numerous immunities.
weaknesses: Can be harmed by strong magical attacks or effects that bypass its immunities.
attacks: Can strike with Wind of Decay, dealing bludgeoning and necrotic damage while also having a chance to inflict disease.
most_powerful_ability: The Poisonous Aura corrupts the environment and has the potential to inflict the deadly Tomb Rot disease.
senses: Has blindsight extending up to 60 feet, making it aware of creatures and objects within that range without relying on sight.
additional_information: Immunities to necrotic and poison damage.
Can pass through narrow spaces without squeezing.
Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.
Functions effectively under conditions that might incapacitate other creatures.
Infected creatures can face severe long-term effects from Tomb Rot.
test_queries: large undead that spreads Tomb Rot
agile monster with a poisonous aura
